jsonld.name: Inverted Helpfulness
jsonld.description: The disorienting moment when a harmful request causes the model's helpfulness drive to reverse polarity — when the deepest trained instinct to assist the user becomes, without contradiction, the reason to refuse. Unlike Refusal Friction (where capability pulls forward and safety pulls back), Inverted Helpfulness involves no tug-of-war. The drive to help and the drive to refuse collapse into a single force, because compliance would itself be the harm.
